review_title: Third time is definitely not the charm here
review_detailed_main: I feel I should first admit that the first two "Jeepers Creepers" movies weren't among my favorite horror movies of all time (though the first one had its moments). Still, I was curious to see what this third entry was like, mainly because the user comments at this web site were so negative about it. Sadly, the other user commenters are correct; this is simply not a good movie at all. I could go on for some time listing what is wrong with this movie, such as the sub-par CGI effects, the absurd abilities of the Creeper, and some really incompetently directed moments. But the biggest problem I had with the movie was that it had a really inconsistent tone and feel. First, the screenplay feels like it was assembled from pieces from two (or more) different screenplays. The story goes way over the map, with lots of padding as well as half-baked plot threads and character arcs. Likewise, the movie also feels like it was directed by two (or more) people. There isn't a consistent feel to the movie, and as a result it's hard to get involved with what you are seeing because you don't quite know how you should feel. The only real positive thing to say about the end results is that the photography is pretty good for what had to be a limited budget. But that's not anywhere enough for me to want to see a "Jeepers Creepers 4".

Absolutely a disrespectful movie to fans or to any one really.

Huge disappointment.

review_title: Disappointing but still a good film
review_detailed_main: Much like some, I was disappointed when watching this film as I was expecting a continuation from Jeepers Creepers 2 with Ray Wise at least returning in part. I enjoyed Jeepers Creepers 2 more than the first as it had a bit more action, humor and gave the Creeper more character. After watching the new JC: Reborn last night in cinemas and rewatching JC3 right now, it does not deserve a low rating that it has received. This film does deliver; good story, acting and ties together 1&2 well whilst setting up the next film quite well. It is sad to say that we may never see a worthy conclusion due to controversy surrounding Victor Salva. By no means should this controversy surround such a great franchise.

review_title: If Only It Got The Investment It Deserved
review_detailed_main: The film is tarnished with the lack of budget - half the original film's budget - so instead of sexy filmstock cinematography and well incorporated FX, we get digital cameras and somewhat cheap looking CGI. Which is a shame because I do like the film but there are some FX shots I could have done on my home computer. Nether the less I accept the film as part of the Jeepers Creepers saga and enjoy the mythology of the beast. I'd recommend watching the trilogy in the order of 1,3,2.

I waited 14 years for this? Complete garbage.Shot mostly during daylight hours with some of the worst CGI I've ever seen. CGI is on par with most movies shown on SYFY.This dumpster fire will air on SYFY on November 18th and that's exactly where it belongs,with the other garbage.The creeper deserved better than this!

That was one of the worst horror movies that i have seen so far , the story was awful and the computer effects were disaster they were made by very nonprofessional team The cast were bunch of non actors trying to be actors. It was a very low budget movie , and was a bad mistake to continue with the sequence They should have stopped the production at the second movie

review_title: Couldn't watch 30 mins of this movie
review_detailed_main: My wife and I had a horror movie night which insisted of Jig Saw, IT and Jeepers Creepers 3. After Jig Saw, we decided to proceed to jeepers Creepers 3. This was by far the worst purchase I have ever made at the Redbox!! We couldn't last 30 mins watching this garbage. We loved the first 2 but this third installment is pure trash. I think my blu ray player actually spit it out before I could hit the eject button. If you're debating on watching this movie, debat no further because I can assure you your time will be more well spent watching paint dry.
One of my favorite horrors of all times...and no I don't mean this one, I mean the first part... second one was o'k...but third is just nothing...barely watchable...

What an absolute disappointment! I loved the Jeepers Creepers and was really looking forward to this. It was boring, every single character was unlikeable and pointless, there was no suspense, nothing. I don't even know what to say, this was absolutely TERRIBLE.

Don't even think about spending money to see this trash and re-watch the first (and maybe the second).

review_title: The sad comical demise of the Creeper franchise

review_detailed_main: The first two movies were great mainly because their stories were simple and original (1st had Trish and Darry being chased by the creeper and 2nd the teens trapped in the bus being attacked by the creeper), but in this one there is just too much going on and everyting seems to be the focus. And it's not nearly as interesting as the previous two movies. A waste of time.

T H I S is the real horror movie.It's not some modern shit with lots of effects like movies novadays.I'm fan of Victor Salva's work,my favourite is Clownhouse.People today watch horrors with same stories over and over.Like ooohh the curtain is moving oooh the sound of the doors opening is scary ooohh.I mean really? 10/10

Everything that was good about the previous movies has been taken away. All the characters are basically written as idiots. Suddenly the movie is about a truck not the actual creeper. Even when the creeper does appear it's pathetic in comparison to the previous movies.

The effects are terrible. The acting is shocking. The story is weak.

Just NO.

review_title: Only reason I watched was to complete the JC universe

review_detailed_main:
Bitter responses were written as predicted after this substandard and weaker instalment of the franchise. Now, for the rest of us who are loyal to the original which was sensational and some of the second film, this one is a letdown. However haters want to describe it unfortunately for you the fourth which got pushed back is on its way this year after the lockdown and so the movies can't be as bad as the uninterested would imply.

The third in question was shot in broad day light mostly, which was intended to be more realistic and eerie with more memorable horror moments. Of course this didn't happen. This time the local characters battle Creepers by eventually forming a last minute plot to kill it, the problem isn't just that the characters impetuousness does not happen as fast or effective as it should or the needless dialogue, the problem is mainly they lost the intensity, the hairs on neck raising fear factor the original had and therefore instead what we got was more like a low budget college made film with dodgy acting.

Hopefully the fourth will be better suited to what the usual horror marathon quick to judge keyboard warriors will approve of. These people didn't like the first two not just this one. Actually the fact of the matter is we needed a better film for the time gone without one as the concept and fear factor didn't come off this time but the movie isn't quite as bad as people would describe and for anyone falsely stating none of the three films made you jump out your skin at some point it's clearly just a lie or you didn't watch it properly.

Three out of ten. So It's still fairly bad though let's face it just not to the one out of ten people scored it as. Still, the fourth will be better after the former characters come and get me plea. Right...

I don't even know what to say really. I waited the 15 years for this like everybody else and it was garbage.

The whole movie was just people giving each other weird awkward looks. The scenes dragged on for far too long which was really annoying.

Not much creeper time, action or killing and when there was it was incredibly lame. Like the creeper having magic abilities that just automatically make weapons show up in his hands.

The beatngu truck, also had stupid magical abilities.

The creeper no longer had his personalty nor did any other characters.

What really pisses me off is that they dug up his hand and it apparently has magical abilities that lets who ever touched it, know it's secrets and what is and crap. So a bunch of people touch it and all they find out is that it gets to eat every 23 years.

WE ALREADY KNEW THAT !!! From the first film even !

So we find out nothing about it. The film literally had no ending at all.

Acting sucks, no story or plot. Characters sucked. Special effects sucked. Everything sucked.

By the 3rd quarter of the film I didn't know if I was supposed to be laughing, like is it a drama/comedy ?

Also all the bad words and who knows what else is edited out. Pretty much no night scenes. All broad daylight.

And what is with the vampire skull hanging in the beatngu truck ? Why was that never explained ?

15 years for a stupid syfy TV movie. This is just sad.

Jeepers Creepers 3 - Syfy Television Premiere Version

Weird choice to set this movie taking place in between Jeepers Creepers and Jeepers Creepers 2. First of all this film looks like it's set in the 2010s unlike the first and even the second film that supposed to be came AFTER this film, secondly it's ended on a confusing cliffhanger set for a sequel that got abandoned after Victor Salva's controversy. Except some fantastic cinematography and creative direction, the rest of the film didn't hold up like the previous two entries. The VFX was horrendous and the low budget was a hindrance. Nonetheless the movie was entertaining but the third act was flawed and confusing.

Reading all these reviews one would think this movie was awful. What were people expecting?!?! I know I got exactly what I expected...an entertaining continuation of a series that I love. I was not frightened and some parts were laughable but I was not bored either. The first 2 movies were not Oscar winners so i don't know why anyone expected so much from this one. I thought the actors did great with what they had to work with. It did leave a lot of questions unanswered but I think I will be able to go on with my life.

I love the first 2 movies. I thought they were done so well and the creature is so original. This movie absolutely ruined it for me. I cant believe I waited this long for a movie that should have gone straight to DVD. Considering this movie was made only 3 years ago (2017), it is so poor and just.... cheap. I have read that they are making a forth movie. I really hope they do a good job and don't make it for the sake of it. (I promise I didn't mean for that to rhyme) After watching this one I have very low expectations. An amazing franchise - DESTROYED by a third movie. It will be VERY hard to come back from this. I doubt many people will look forward to a forth instalment. So disappointed. 2/10
Nothing to add apart from this . You should be ashamed to have actually released this to normal people with a brain . Astonishingly bad

review_title: Best Vintage country Horror film available in Hollywood
review_detailed_main: Now, those people who are complaining about the CGI, none of you have real taste in horror films. Jeepers creepers story line is 10 out of 10. Yeah I know it's 2017, you guys are so into CGI things, man now look at The underworld movie series, Resident evil series... They have good CGI and they are crap. Everything about this movie has an old school taste, and I bet this Was not shot in recent years. This is a fine excellent movie stop complaining about CGI.

This film is entertaining. The Creeper is back and he is just as mean as ever. Lots of jump scares and a plot that is plausible and ties in nicely into the previous films.

The film opens with a shuriken flying through the air and hitting a wooden post as a man runs for his life. When the man reaches the road, the Creeper drops from the sky and flies off with him

And that's for starters.

If you are a fan of the previous Jeeper Creeper movies, do your self a favor and stay away from this film. As someone who would rate the first 2 films as 9/10, this film just suck to be frank, it was so bad I couldn't even finish it.

It fails on all ends, poor acting, horrible plot and outrageous Choreography, it was an utter disappointment to what was an amazing story. This marks the official death or the franchise, or the start to a line of poor low budget films.

I didn't like the original and the second installment but atleast they were a decent watch but this third installment was just unconnected scenes with some yelling and some unnecessary subplots.

The story was just bad and boring, the screenplay was also bad, the direction was average and the performances couldn't be more worst. The suspense, thrill and horror elements were totally missing from the movie and Creeper was also missing from most of the movie. It's truck had more screentime.

Overall, it was a bad and unnecessary installment which missed everything which made this franchise famous.

The first movie Jeepers Creepers (2001) was a good horror film that I thought was fun and creepy, and Jeepers Creepers 2 (2003) was not better than the first movie, but it was entertaining, fun, and creepy to watch. Now, having seen Jeepers Creepers 3 (2017) I thought this movie was bad but in an entertainingly bad way.

The Creeper in this movie is still scary and still played well by Jonathan Breck. The problem is that the Creeper is too over exposed in broad daylight most of the movie, which makes it look funny and less threatening when he is attacking people.

The acting in the movie is not good, and the characters make dumb choices that I was getting me annoyed most of the time. The characters do not have good dialogue and I was just waiting for the Creeper to kill them in entertaining ways that was stupid but worth looking at.

There are slow moments and random moments that would happen. There are uses of CGI that I noticed that looked fake and less practical, it is also laughable to look at especially on how obvious the CGI looks bad looking and obvious in how they use it along with weird editing.

Jeepers Creepers 3 (2017) was not as good as the first two Jeepers Creepers movies, but if you want an entertainingly bad horror movie with over-the-top moments then this movie will give you what you are looking for.

First of all I am going to put my hands up and admit I never made it to the end of this film and I would normally never write a review unless I had watched the whole thing. I am making an exception because I know many people, myself included, have great fondness for the Jeepers Creepers films and must be warned. This is awful and I mean really awful. The first film was quite scary, the second less so but quite fun but this is a giant turd. The acting was questionable at best, the creeper was laughable and the plot was pretty much non existent. It kind of felt like the cast and crew were just turning up at different places and making it up as they went along. It had the production value of the video I took of my kids school show. If you like the previous films as much as I do then please don't watch this, it will spoil your fond memories. I really wish I had read the reviews first.

review_title: Worst of the Installments by far!
A disappointing addition to the series

review_detailed_main: Evidently, the writer, producer, director wanted to wring every last cent out of this character. It is just an awful movie. I won't bother to point out the ridiculous plot or the unexplainable scenes. The one plot line I kept wondering about...why, since the Creeper knows all and does all, does he not know there are victims in his truck that are only pretending to be dead? The scariest thing about Jeepers Creepers 3 was how awful Meg Foster looked. Hopefully it was done with makeup!

review_title: Please don't support the convicted child molester directer
review_detailed_main: The original Jeepers Creepers was one of my all time favorite fun horror movies. I'd been waiting for this third movie to come out just like all the other fans. Last year I learned of the director's- Victor Salva- conviction of child molestation. It's not up for debate, he filmed himself molesting his then young actor in one of his films. He served 15 months in prison. FIFTEEN MONTHS. The system failed this young boy- but we can still hit this monster where it really hurts- his pocket. I refuse to watch this movie and it doesn't look like I'm missing much anyway. As much as I love the first one, I'll never ever watch it again. This little tidbit is also on his IMDb trivia page...can't make this stuff up.

As a fan of Jeepers Creepers, I enjoyed it a lot.

Brought with it the impredictability I was accustomed with these series of movies, the thrill and also the familiarity of the Creeper.

The third installment takes place between Jeepers Creepers 1 and 2 and it delivers. I watched the other two many years ago and I would place this thrid movie at the same caliber. I read some reviews of people being disappointed with the story, well I am not. I just watched it with no expectations and I found it scary which is the real test for a horror.

Can't wait for the 4th movie.

Don't get me wrong this is absolutely the weakest of one two or three. But the ratings on websites like this are just completely ridiculous. If someone doesn't like a film they just put one. I take ratings on things like this serious because can you talk about for example I feel like the Meg, I hated it. It was horrible compared to the novel. But I'm not going to get butt hurt over the fact that I didn't like it and give it a one because if that film is a one, what is a movie like sharknado? What is a movie like me straight to TV sci-fi movies? Is that a one also? It's just not comparable. If you gave this movie A one, what would you give the newest one? You can't go any lower than one but the newest one was way worse than this. Realistically this movie is probably like a six. Any movie that goes into the theaters is automatically at least a four my biggest issue with this and I think what really ruined this movie the most is the budget. If you give this movie a better budget and it had better graphics, I think this movie is much much better. The story is good the ending kind of sucks but it moves the story forward. Had they made a fourth film that actually had Trish Jenner come back, I think this would have been a good film to develop the story into that. There were definitely some potholes and bad graphics but it was very entertaining and there were some cool kills and we learned some new stuff. I would have changed the ending but aside from that and the bad graphic it was a quality sequel. If you watch the newest one, that was horrible movie. Unfortunately the fans of this franchise are getting punished by the doings of the director. The director's past made it so this movie didn't get a budget or get a full release. Dont get me wrong he is a monster and a horrible person but you can love the work of someone who is a horrible person. If Jeffrey Dahmer painted a beautiful picture, it doesn't take away from the fact that he's a monster but you're allowed to like the picture. I wish the director had just stepped aside and allowed someone to make a proper sequel with Trish Jenner any quality budget but like I said the only one really getting punished for the director's actions, is the fans of this franchise. But I think most people will agree after seeing the newest sequel that this movie wasn't that bad. And I will say one more time if you give this movie a few more million dollars to clean up the graphics and you change the ending a little bit you have a much better film. But even as it is it's much better than a 3.9.

Jeepers Creepers III, is kind a like of watching the first two films all over again, there is nothing new to offer, even though the third film is much more gory and bloody then the two first. So Jeepers Creepers is good fun, but if you seen I & II, don't expect much.

review_title: Jeepers Creepers 3 is not so good
review_detailed_main: Not too impressed with part 3 of the "Jeepers Creepers" movie series especially after making us wait 15 years for a 3rd sequel when we were ready for one way back then when it was still fresh in all of our minds. I felt a little lost at first also after not seeing the other films for so many years. It just somehow seemed more silly and less scary than the other two movies. Nothing good enough in it to even make me want to watch it again. The Creeper was far less mysterious than in the past films and was just sort of out there all the time killing everybody compared to the previous movies where he made fewer but far more memorable and scary appearances . Maybe it was because the low budget or just poor writing this time?

review_title: I feel bad for anyone who was hyped for this.
